Hi Friends

I am in process of writing EJBs - basically i am writing two separate layers
of stateless session EJBs one layer will be responsible of holding Business
logic and other one for doing RDBMS activities ( I can  use Entity Beans for
the same but client don't wants to use Entity Beans at all  )

I am delegating the RDBMS task to small size java helper classes and using
this classes in second layer EJB to perform the RDBMS tasks . These helper
classes mainly contains SQL stmts .

As there is very strong possibility that RDBMS end(Tabels\ Field Length
etc )  may go for number of changes which may or may not affect these
classes. I want to device a suitable Unit Testing  techniques so that I can
test my these helper classes as when required.

PLz guide me by sharing your similar experiences "How you tested java
classes having embedded SQL in it."

regards
L P
